nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Teacher Practice & Workload

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Protect deep skills: Guard deep literacy, reasoning, and “productive struggle” from cognitive offloading/skill atrophy.  Personalize learning: Use AI for tutoring, feedback, and targeted supports (when accurate and appropriate).  Keep learning human: Rebalance toward hands-on work, discussion, and authentic thinking—not screen-mediated compliance.
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Protect deep skills: Guard deep literacy, reasoning, and “productive struggle” from cognitive offloading/skill atrophy.  Personalize learning: Use AI for tutoring, feedback, and targeted supports (when accurate and appropriate).  Keep learning human: Rebalance toward hands-on work, discussion, and authentic thinking—not screen-mediated compliance.

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Clarify boundaries: Define fair use vs cheating, plus consistent student attribution expectations.  Design for evidence: Redesign assessments for “process evidence” (drafts, oral defense, in-class performance, authentic products).  Avoid detector traps: Don’t rely on “AI detectors”; use instruction + assessment design that makes integrity visible.
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Clarify boundaries: Define fair use vs cheating, plus consistent student attribution expectations.  Design for evidence: Redesign assessments for “process evidence” (drafts, oral defense, in-class performance, authentic products).  Avoid detector traps: Don’t rely on “AI detectors”; use instruction + assessment design that makes integrity visible.

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Reduce busywork: Use AI to lower admin load while preserving teacher professional judgment and agency.  Support consistency: Provide PD, exemplars, and staff playbooks to prevent uneven practice and high-stakes misuse.  Protect the profession: Don’t assume AI time-savings for staffing; guard against deprofessionalization.
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Reduce busywork: Use AI to lower admin load while preserving teacher professional judgment and agency.  Support consistency: Provide PD, exemplars, and staff playbooks to prevent uneven practice and high-stakes misuse.  Protect the profession: Don’t assume AI time-savings for staffing; guard against deprofessionalization.

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)

nodes.text: Safe Tooling, Privacy & Community Trust

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Governance, Guardrails & Adaptation

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Close access gaps: Ensure equitable access to vetted tools and supports so adoption doesn’t widen gaps.  Design for inclusion: Build accessibility/UDL requirements in from day one (SPED/504/ELL, accommodations, families).  Require human review: Treat AI outputs as assistive—not authoritative—especially for disability-related/high-stakes decisions.
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Close access gaps: Ensure equitable access to vetted tools and supports so adoption doesn’t widen gaps.  Design for inclusion: Build accessibility/UDL requirements in from day one (SPED/504/ELL, accommodations, families).  Require human review: Treat AI outputs as assistive—not authoritative—especially for disability-related/high-stakes decisions.

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Minimize exposure: Reduce student data risk; verify vendor terms and FERPA/IDEA-aligned protections before use.  Stop shadow adoption: Clarify what’s allowed, what requires approval, and what’s prohibited.  Build trust openly: Address safety + transparency (content risks, plain-language communication, ethical concerns).
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Minimize exposure: Reduce student data risk; verify vendor terms and FERPA/IDEA-aligned protections before use.  Stop shadow adoption: Clarify what’s allowed, what requires approval, and what’s prohibited.  Build trust openly: Address safety + transparency (content risks, plain-language communication, ethical concerns).

group_path: F1 — Inputs: Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes)
raw_fields: Keep policy agile: Make guidance usable and revisable, with an explicit review cadence as AI evolves.  Tier tool use: Use a tiered tool/use-case pathway that enables safe experimentation without overregulation.  Demand evidence: Collect qualitative/quantitative feedback to avoid policy “based on vibes.”
nodes.source_csv_path: project_files/03 - Values & Principles/F1  Inputs- Top Risks + Top Opportunities (Synthesized Themes).csv
nodes.text: Keep policy agile: Make guidance usable and revisable, with an explicit review cadence as AI evolves.  Tier tool use: Use a tiered tool/use-case pathway that enables safe experimentation without overregulation.  Demand evidence: Collect qualitative/quantitative feedback to avoid policy “based on vibes.”
Pass

“Staff will have a voice / a THINK TANK that will be encouraged.”
“Pre-define a common language of AI use cases for FCCPS community.”
“No AI detectors until proven adequate AND FAIR.”
Equity by design. “Access… does not depend on home resources.”
“FCCPS will not require the use of AI to achieve academic success…”
“Little to no AI in IEP process.”
“Ongoing review of evidence-based practice for innovation.”
“Encourage use of AI to create additional materials in line with UDL.”
“Assigned roles on checking + monitoring… leaks, privacy.”
“Consider use of on-prem AI models to avoid ethical/control issues…”
“Gather before and after data to understand effects of new AI actors.”
“Require transparency from students and staff when AI is used.”

raw_fields: Below is an F3 Quality Filter pass on the principle candidates visible in your photos (seeds + write-ins). I used these F3 checks: Clear actor + scope (FCCPS can actually do it)Single idea (not a bundle of 3–4 claims)Policy-level (direction/standard), not an implementation to-doTestable/operationalizable (someone could later write guidance/rubrics/controls)Not redundant (or explicitly marked to merge)Avoids absolutes that create unintended constraints (“no AI ever…”) unless truly required

raw_fields: Net result (what’s “clean” enough to keep moving) PASS (as principles now): all seed cards + 2 write-ins that can stand as principles with light polish (Student safety/developmental appropriateness, AI literacy for students+staff).REVISE: most write-ins (good intent, need to become policy-level, single-idea statements, often best as merges).PARK: items that are unclear, solution-specific (on-prem), redundant, or privacy-colliding (teacher access to AI-use history).If you want, I can take only the PASS + best REVISE-as-merge items and output a single consolidated set of revised candidate principles (still pre-F4 cap), preserving initials/tags.
nodes.text: Net result (what’s “clean” enough to keep moving) PASS (as principles now): all seed cards + 2 write-ins that can stand as principles with light polish (Student safety/developmental appropriateness, AI literacy for students+staff).REVISE: most write-ins (good intent, need to become policy-level, single-idea statements, often best as merges).PARK: items that are unclear, solution-specific (on-prem), redundant, or privacy-colliding (teacher access to AI-use history).If you want, I can take only the PASS + best REVISE-as-merge items and output a single consolidated set of revised candidate principles (still pre-F4 cap), preserving initials/tags.
